title: Public transport for the Victorian Caravan and Camping Supershow: Wednesday 21 February to Sunday 25 February 2024
articleContent:
Public transport for the Victorian Caravan and Camping Supershow: Wednesday 21 February to Sunday 25 February 2024

Events > Expos

Victorian Caravan and Camping Supershow is returning to Melbourne Showground and Public Transport is the best way to travel to and from Victorian Caravan and Camping Supershow, with extra trains running to and from Melbourne Showgrounds from Saturday 24 to Sunday 25 February only:

  • Download the Flemington precinct map (PDF) 455kb
  • Download the Flemington precinct map - accessible version (DOCX) 30kB

Please also check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey before you travel.

Wednesday 21 Febuary, Thursday 22 February and Friday 23 February

Passengers are advised to catch a Craigieburn line train, change at Newmarket Station and then catch a Route 57 tram to Melbourne Showgrounds.

Saturday 24 February

 Metropolitan train

Getting to the Showgrounds

Trains will depart from Southern Cross Station (Platform 8), North Melbourne Station (Platform 2) and then travel express to Melbourne Showgrounds Station.

Additional services departing from 9.09am

  • 9:09am – 5:10pm every 20 minutes

Leaving the Showgrounds

Additional services departing from the 9:29am

Trains will depart the Showgrounds from:

  • 9:29am – 5:28pm every 20 minutes

The last train departs Showgrounds Station at 5.28pm.

Passengers travelling outside these times are advised to catch a Craigieburn line train, change at Newmarket Station and then catch a Route 57 tram to Melbourne Showgrounds.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from the Showgrounds

Passengers can catch a Route 57 tram, alighting at Stop 32 Sandown Road. 

Passenger advise to walk approximately 200 metres to Showgrounds entrance.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

Metropolitan bus

Getting to and from the Showgrounds

The following bus route travels close to the Showgrounds:

  • Route 472 (Williamstown - Moonee Ponds via Footscray) - Alight at stop RAS Showgrounds/Langs Road (Ascot Vale).

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

Sunday 25 February

 Metropolitan train

Getting to the Showgrounds

Trains will depart from Southern Cross Station (Platform 8), North Melbourne Station (Platform 2) and then travel express to Melbourne Showgrounds Station.

Additional services departing from 9.09am:

  • 9:09am to 5:10pm every 20 minutes

Leaving the Showgrounds

Additional services departing from 9:29am

Trains will depart the Showgrounds from:

  • 9:29am to 5:28pm every 20 minutes

The last train departs Showgrounds Station at 5.28pm.

Passengers travelling outside  these times are advised to catch are advised to catch a Craigieburn line train, change at Newmarket Station and then catch a Route 57 tram to Melbourne Showgrounds.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from the Showgrounds

Passengers can catch a Route 57 tram, alighting at Stop 32 Sandown Road. 

Passenger advise to walk approximately 200 metres to Showgrounds entrance.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

 Metropolitan bus

Getting to and from the Showgrounds

The following bus route travels close to the Showgrounds:

  • Route 472 (Williamstown - Moonee Ponds via Footscray) - Alight at stop RAS Showgrounds/Langs Road (Ascot Vale).

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

Additional information

  • Please check the Disruptions for notification of any service changes that may affect your journey to and from the event.
  • To plan your route, please utilise the PTV Journey planner.
  • Download the free PTV mobile apps for Android and iOS and access public transport information on the go.
  • Customers requiring accessibility information and assistance, see Accessible transport.
  • Customers are advised to top up prior to travelling or to set auto top up so that you never need to top up again. For more information, see auto top up your myki.
  • For information on ticketing for children and concessions, see Children and Concessions.
  • Customers needing further information or special assistance, please call 1800 800 007 prior to travelling.

Subscribe for weekly travel updates

Keep up to date with planned disruptions on your line/route and across the network by subscribing to our weekly travel update email.

Follow us on social media

For official updates and event information, follow us on Twitter. For news, inspiration, hints and tips on Victoria’s public transport network, follow us on Facebook.
articleDescription: Victorian Caravan & Camping Supershow is returning to Melbourne Showground and Public Transport is the best way to travel to and from Victorian Caravan, Camping & Touring Supershow, with extra trains running to and from Melbourne Showgrounds from Saturday 24 to Sunday 25 February only:
